bit_field_value.name: EIMR_TXB_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The corresponding interrupt source is masked.

bit_field_value.name: EIMR_TXB_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The corresponding interrupt source is not masked.

bit_field_value.name: EIMR_TXF_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The corresponding interrupt source is masked.

bit_field_value.name: EIMR_TXF_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The corresponding interrupt source is not masked.

bit_field_value.name: EIMR_GRA_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The corresponding interrupt source is masked.

bit_field_value.name: EIMR_GRA_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The corresponding interrupt source is not masked.

bit_field_value.name: EIMR_BABT_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The corresponding interrupt source is masked.

bit_field_value.name: EIMR_BABT_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The corresponding interrupt source is not masked.

bit_field_value.name: EIMR_BABR_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The corresponding interrupt source is masked.

bit_field_value.name: EIMR_BABR_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The corresponding interrupt source is not masked.

bit_field_value.name: ECR_ETHEREN_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Reception immediately stops and transmission stops after a bad CRC is appended to any currently transmitted frame.

bit_field_value.name: ECR_ETHEREN_0b1
bit_field_value.description: MAC is enabled, and reception and transmission are possible.

bit_field_value.name: ECR_MAGICEN_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Magic detection logic disabled.

bit_field_value.name: ECR_MAGICEN_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The MAC core detects magic packets and asserts EIR[WAKEUP] when a frame is detected.

bit_field_value.name: ECR_SLEEP_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Normal operating mode.

bit_field_value.name: ECR_SLEEP_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Sleep mode.

bit_field_value.name: ECR_EN1588_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Legacy FEC buffer descriptors and functions enabled.

bit_field_value.name: ECR_EN1588_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enhanced frame time-stamping functions enabled.

bit_field_value.name: ECR_DBGEN_0b0
bit_field_value.description: MAC continues operation in debug mode.

bit_field_value.name: ECR_DBGEN_0b1
bit_field_value.description: MAC enters hardware freeze mode when the processor is in debug mode.

bit_field_value.name: ECR_DBSWP_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The buffer descriptor bytes are not swapped to support big-endian devices.

bit_field_value.name: ECR_DBSWP_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The buffer descriptor bytes are swapped to support little-endian devices.

bit_field_value.name: MSCR_DIS_PRE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Preamble enabled.

bit_field_value.name: MSCR_DIS_PRE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Preamble (32 ones) is not prepended to the MII management frame.

bit_field_value.name: MSCR_HOLDTIME_0b000
bit_field_value.description: 1 internal module clock cycle

bit_field_value.name: MSCR_HOLDTIME_0b001
bit_field_value.description: 2 internal module clock cycles

bit_field_value.name: MSCR_HOLDTIME_0b010
bit_field_value.description: 3 internal module clock cycles

bit_field_value.name: MSCR_HOLDTIME_0b111
bit_field_value.description: 8 internal module clock cycles

bit_field_value.name: MIBC_MIB_CLEAR_0b0
bit_field_value.description: See note above.

bit_field_value.name: MIBC_MIB_CLEAR_0b1
bit_field_value.description: All statistics counters are reset to 0.

bit_field_value.name: MIBC_MIB_IDLE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The MIB block is updating MIB counters.

bit_field_value.name: MIBC_MIB_IDLE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The MIB block is not currently updating any MIB counters.

bit_field_value.name: MIBC_MIB_DIS_0b0
bit_field_value.description: MIB logic is enabled.

bit_field_value.name: MIBC_MIB_DIS_0b1
bit_field_value.description: MIB logic is disabled. The MIB logic halts and does not update any MIB counters.

bit_field_value.name: RCR_LOOP_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Loopback disabled.

bit_field_value.name: RCR_LOOP_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Transmitted frames are looped back internal to the device and transmit MII output signals are not asserted. DRT must be cleared.

bit_field_value.name: RCR_DRT_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Receive path operates independently of transmit. Used for full-duplex or to monitor transmit activity in half-duplex mode.

bit_field_value.name: RCR_DRT_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Disable reception of frames while transmitting. Normally used for half-duplex mode.

bit_field_value.name: RCR_MII_MODE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: MII or RMII mode, as indicated by the RMII_MODE field.

bit_field_value.name: RCR_RMII_MODE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: MAC configured for MII mode.

bit_field_value.name: RCR_RMII_MODE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: MAC configured for RMII operation.

bit_field_value.name: RCR_RMII_10T_0b0
bit_field_value.description: 100 Mbps operation.

bit_field_value.name: RCR_RMII_10T_0b1
bit_field_value.description: 10 Mbps operation.

bit_field.name: PADEN
bit_field.description: Enable Frame Padding Remove On Receive

bit_field_value.name: RCR_PADEN_0b0
bit_field_value.description: No padding is removed on receive by the MAC.

bit_field_value.name: RCR_PADEN_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Padding is removed from received frames.

bit_field_value.name: RCR_PAUFWD_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Pause frames are terminated and discarded in the MAC.

bit_field_value.name: RCR_PAUFWD_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Pause frames are forwarded to the user application.

bit_field_value.name: RCR_CRCFWD_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The CRC field of received frames is transmitted to the user application.

bit_field_value.name: RCR_CRCFWD_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The CRC field is stripped from the frame.

bit_field_value.name: RCR_CFEN_0b0
bit_field_value.description: MAC control frames with any opcode other than 0x0001 (pause frame) are accepted and forwarded to the client interface.

bit_field_value.name: RCR_CFEN_0b1
bit_field_value.description: MAC control frames with any opcode other than 0x0001 (pause frame) are silently discarded.

bit_field_value.name: RCR_NLC_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The payload length check is disabled.

bit_field_value.name: RCR_NLC_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The core checks the frame's payload length with the frame length/type field. Errors are indicated in the EIR[PLC] field.

bit_field_value.name: TCR_TFC_PAUSE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: No PAUSE frame transmitted.

bit_field_value.name: TCR_TFC_PAUSE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The MAC stops transmission of data frames after the current transmission is complete.

bit_field.name: ADDSEL
bit_field.description: Source MAC Address Select On Transmit

bit_field_value.name: TCR_ADDSEL_0b000
bit_field_value.description: Node MAC address programmed on PADDR1/2 registers.

bit_field_value.name: TCR_ADDINS_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The source MAC address is not modified by the MAC.

bit_field_value.name: TCR_ADDINS_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The MAC overwrites the source MAC address with the programmed MAC address according to ADDSEL.

bit_field.name: CRCFWD
bit_field.description: Forward Frame From Application With CRC

bit_field_value.name: TCR_CRCFWD_0b0
bit_field_value.description: TxBD[TC] controls whether the frame has a CRC from the application.

bit_field_value.name: TCR_CRCFWD_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The transmitter does not append any CRC to transmitted frames, as it is expecting a frame with CRC from the application.

bit_field.name: PADDR2
bit_field.description: Bytes 4 (bits 31:24) and 5 (bits 23:16) of the 6-byte individual address used for exact match, and the source address field in PAUSE frames.

bit_field.name: IADDR1
bit_field.description: Contains the upper 32 bits of the 64-bit hash table used in the address recognition process for receive frames with a unicast address. Bit 31 of IADDR1 contains hash index bit 63. Bit 0 of IADDR1 contains hash index bit 32.

bit_field.name: IADDR2
bit_field.description: Contains the lower 32 bits of the 64-bit hash table used in the address recognition process for receive frames with a unicast address. Bit 31 of IADDR2 contains hash index bit 31. Bit 0 of IADDR2 contains hash index bit 0.

bit_field.name: GADDR1
bit_field.description: Contains the upper 32 bits of the 64-bit hash table used in the address recognition process for receive frames with a multicast address. Bit 31 of GADDR1 contains hash index bit 63. Bit 0 of GADDR1 contains hash index bit 32.

bit_field.name: GADDR2
bit_field.description: Contains the lower 32 bits of the 64-bit hash table used in the address recognition process for receive frames with a multicast address. Bit 31 of GADDR2 contains hash index bit 31. Bit 0 of GADDR2 contains hash index bit 0.

bit_field_value.name: TFWR_TFWR_0b000000
bit_field_value.description: 64 bytes written.

bit_field_value.name: TFWR_TFWR_0b000001
bit_field_value.description: 64 bytes written.

bit_field_value.name: TFWR_TFWR_0b000010
bit_field_value.description: 128 bytes written.

bit_field_value.name: TFWR_TFWR_0b000011
bit_field_value.description: 192 bytes written.

bit_field_value.name: TFWR_TFWR_0b011111
bit_field_value.description: 1984 bytes written.

bit_field_value.name: TFWR_STRFWD_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Reset. The transmission start threshold is programmed in TFWR[TFWR].

bit_field.name: R_DES_START
bit_field.description: Pointer to the beginning of the receive buffer descriptor queue.

register.name: TDSR
register.description: Transmit Buffer Descriptor Ring Start Register

bit_field.name: X_DES_START
bit_field.description: Pointer to the beginning of the transmit buffer descriptor queue.

bit_field.name: R_BUF_SIZE
bit_field.description: Receive buffer size in bytes. This value, concatenated with the four least-significant bits of this register (which are always zero), is the effective maximum receive buffer size.

bit_field.name: RX_SECTION_FULL
bit_field.description: Value Of Receive FIFO Section Full Threshold

bit_field.name: RX_SECTION_EMPTY
bit_field.description: Value Of The Receive FIFO Section Empty Threshold

bit_field.name: STAT_SECTION_EMPTY
bit_field.description: RX Status FIFO Section Empty Threshold

bit_field.name: RX_ALMOST_EMPTY
bit_field.description: Value Of The Receive FIFO Almost Empty Threshold

bit_field.name: RX_ALMOST_FULL
bit_field.description: Value Of The Receive FIFO Almost Full Threshold

bit_field.name: TX_SECTION_EMPTY
bit_field.description: Value Of The Transmit FIFO Section Empty Threshold

bit_field.name: TX_ALMOST_EMPTY
bit_field.description: Value of Transmit FIFO Almost Empty Threshold

bit_field.name: TX_ALMOST_FULL
bit_field.description: Value Of The Transmit FIFO Almost Full Threshold

bit_field_value.name: TACC_SHIFT16_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Indicates to the transmit data FIFO that the written frames contain two additional octets before the frame data. This means the actual frame begins at bit 16 of the first word written into the FIFO. This function allows putting the frame payload on a 32-bit boundary in memory, as the 14-byte Ethernet header is extended to a 16-byte header.

bit_field.name: IPCHK
bit_field.description: Enables insertion of IP header checksum.

bit_field_value.name: TACC_IPCHK_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Checksum is not inserted.

bit_field_value.name: TACC_IPCHK_0b1
bit_field_value.description: If an IP frame is transmitted, the checksum is inserted automatically. The IP header checksum field must be cleared. If a non-IP frame is transmitted the frame is not modified.

bit_field_value.name: TACC_PROCHK_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Checksum not inserted.

bit_field_value.name: TACC_PROCHK_0b1
bit_field_value.description: If an IP frame with a known protocol is transmitted, the checksum is inserted automatically into the frame. The checksum field must be cleared. The other frames are not modified.

bit_field.name: PADREM
bit_field.description: Enable Padding Removal For Short IP Frames

bit_field_value.name: RACC_PADREM_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Padding not removed.

bit_field_value.name: RACC_PADREM_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Any bytes following the IP payload section of the frame are removed from the frame.

bit_field.name: IPDIS
bit_field.description: Enable Discard Of Frames With Wrong IPv4 Header Checksum

bit_field_value.name: RACC_IPDIS_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Frames with wrong IPv4 header checksum are not discarded.

bit_field_value.name: RACC_IPDIS_0b1
bit_field_value.description: If an IPv4 frame is received with a mismatching header checksum, the frame is discarded. IPv6 has no header checksum and is not affected by this setting. Discarding is only available when the RX FIFO operates in store and forward mode (RSFL cleared).

bit_field.name: PRODIS
bit_field.description: Enable Discard Of Frames With Wrong Protocol Checksum

bit_field_value.name: RACC_PRODIS_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Frames with wrong checksum are not discarded.

bit_field_value.name: RACC_PRODIS_0b1
bit_field_value.description: If a TCP/IP, UDP/IP, or ICMP/IP frame is received that has a wrong TCP, UDP, or ICMP checksum, the frame is discarded. Discarding is only available when the RX FIFO operates in store and forward mode (RSFL cleared).

bit_field.name: LINEDIS
bit_field.description: Enable Discard Of Frames With MAC Layer Errors

bit_field_value.name: RACC_LINEDIS_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Frames with errors are not discarded.

bit_field_value.name: RACC_LINEDIS_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Any frame received with a CRC, length, or PHY error is automatically discarded and not forwarded to the user application interface.

bit_field_value.name: RACC_SHIFT16_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Instructs the MAC to write two additional bytes in front of each frame received into the RX FIFO.

register.name: RMON_T_CRC_ALIGN
register.description: Tx Packets with CRC/Align Error Statistic Register

register.name: RMON_T_UNDERSIZE
register.description: Tx Packets Less Than Bytes and Good CRC Statistic Register

bit_field.name: TXPKTS
bit_field.description: Number of transmit packets less than 64 bytes with good CRC

register.name: RMON_T_OVERSIZE
register.description: Tx Packets GT MAX_FL bytes and Good CRC Statistic Register

bit_field.name: TXPKTS
bit_field.description: Number of transmit packets greater than MAX_FL bytes with good CRC

register.name: RMON_T_FRAG
register.description: Tx Packets Less Than 64 Bytes and Bad CRC Statistic Register

bit_field.name: TXPKTS
bit_field.description: Number of packets less than 64 bytes with bad CRC

register.name: RMON_T_JAB
register.description: Tx Packets Greater Than MAX_FL bytes and Bad CRC Statistic Register

bit_field.name: TXPKTS
bit_field.description: Number of transmit packets greater than MAX_FL bytes and bad CRC

register.name: RMON_T_P_GTE2048
register.description: Tx Packets Greater Than 2048 Bytes Statistic Register

bit_field.name: TXPKTS
bit_field.description: Number of transmit packets greater than 2048 bytes

register.name: IEEE_T_1COL
register.description: Frames Transmitted with Single Collision Statistic Register

bit_field.name: COUNT
bit_field.description: Number of frames transmitted with one collision

register.name: IEEE_T_MCOL
register.description: Frames Transmitted with Multiple Collisions Statistic Register

bit_field.name: COUNT
bit_field.description: Number of frames transmitted with multiple collisions

register.name: IEEE_T_DEF
register.description: Frames Transmitted after Deferral Delay Statistic Register

bit_field.name: COUNT
bit_field.description: Number of frames transmitted with deferral delay

register.name: IEEE_T_LCOL
register.description: Frames Transmitted with Late Collision Statistic Register

bit_field.name: COUNT
bit_field.description: Number of frames transmitted with late collision

register.name: IEEE_T_EXCOL
register.description: Frames Transmitted with Excessive Collisions Statistic Register

bit_field.name: COUNT
bit_field.description: Number of frames transmitted with excessive collisions

register.name: IEEE_T_MACERR
register.description: Frames Transmitted with Tx FIFO Underrun Statistic Register

bit_field.name: COUNT
bit_field.description: Number of frames transmitted with transmit FIFO underrun

register.name: IEEE_T_CSERR
register.description: Frames Transmitted with Carrier Sense Error Statistic Register

bit_field.name: COUNT
bit_field.description: Number of frames transmitted with carrier sense error

bit_field.name: COUNT
bit_field.description: Number of frames transmitted with SQE error

register.name: IEEE_T_FDXFC
register.description: Flow Control Pause Frames Transmitted Statistic Register

bit_field.name: COUNT
bit_field.description: Number of flow-control pause frames transmitted

register.name: IEEE_T_OCTETS_OK
register.description: Octet Count for Frames Transmitted w/o Error Statistic Register

bit_field.name: COUNT
bit_field.description: Octet count for frames transmitted without error Counts total octets (includes header and FCS fields).

register.name: RMON_R_CRC_ALIGN
register.description: Rx Packets with CRC/Align Error Statistic Register

bit_field.name: COUNT
bit_field.description: Number of receive packets with CRC or align error

register.name: RMON_R_UNDERSIZE
register.description: Rx Packets with Less Than 64 Bytes and Good CRC Statistic Register

bit_field.name: COUNT
bit_field.description: Number of receive packets with less than 64 bytes and good CRC

register.name: RMON_R_OVERSIZE
register.description: Rx Packets Greater Than MAX_FL and Good CRC Statistic Register

bit_field.name: COUNT
bit_field.description: Number of receive packets greater than MAX_FL and good CRC

register.name: RMON_R_FRAG
register.description: Rx Packets Less Than 64 Bytes and Bad CRC Statistic Register

bit_field.name: COUNT
bit_field.description: Number of receive packets with less than 64 bytes and bad CRC

register.name: RMON_R_JAB
register.description: Rx Packets Greater Than MAX_FL Bytes and Bad CRC Statistic Register

bit_field.name: COUNT
bit_field.description: Number of receive packets greater than MAX_FL and bad CRC

register.name: RMON_R_P_GTE2048
register.description: Rx Packets Greater than 2048 Bytes Statistic Register

register.name: IEEE_R_DROP
register.description: Frames not Counted Correctly Statistic Register

register.name: IEEE_R_CRC
register.description: Frames Received with CRC Error Statistic Register

bit_field.name: COUNT
bit_field.description: Number of frames received with CRC error

register.name: IEEE_R_ALIGN
register.description: Frames Received with Alignment Error Statistic Register

bit_field.name: COUNT
bit_field.description: Number of frames received with alignment error

register.name: IEEE_R_MACERR
register.description: Receive FIFO Overflow Count Statistic Register

register.name: IEEE_R_FDXFC
register.description: Flow Control Pause Frames Received Statistic Register

bit_field.name: COUNT
bit_field.description: Number of flow-control pause frames received

register.name: IEEE_R_OCTETS_OK
register.description: Octet Count for Frames Received without Error Statistic Register

bit_field.name: COUNT
bit_field.description: Number of octets for frames received without error

bit_field_value.name: ATCR_EN_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The timer stops at the current value.

bit_field_value.name: ATCR_EN_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The timer starts incrementing.

bit_field_value.name: ATCR_OFFEN_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The timer can be reset to zero when the given offset time is reached (offset event). The field is cleared when the offset event is reached, so no further event occurs until the field is set again. The timer offset value must be set before setting this field.

bit_field_value.name: ATCR_OFFRST_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The timer is not affected and no action occurs, besides clearing OFFEN, when the offset is reached.

bit_field_value.name: ATCR_OFFRST_0b1
bit_field_value.description: If OFFEN is set, the timer resets to zero when the offset setting is reached. The offset event does not cause a timer interrupt.

bit_field_value.name: ATCR_PEREN_0b1
bit_field_value.description: A period event interrupt can be generated (EIR[TS_TIMER]) and the event signal output is asserted when the timer wraps around according to the periodic setting ATPER. The timer period value must be set before setting this bit. Not all devices contain the event signal output. See the chip configuration details.

bit_field.name: PINPER
bit_field.description: Enables event signal output assertion on period event. Not all devices contain the event signal output. See the chip configuration details.

bit_field_value.name: ATCR_CAPTURE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: No effect.

bit_field_value.name: ATCR_CAPTURE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The current time is captured and can be read from the ATVR register.

bit_field_value.name: ATCR_SLAVE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The timer is active and all configuration fields in this register are relevant.

bit_field_value.name: ATCR_SLAVE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The internal timer is disabled and the externally provided timer value is used. All other fields, except CAPTURE, in this register have no effect. CAPTURE can still be used to capture the current timer value.

bit_field.name: ATIME
bit_field.description: A write sets the timer. A read returns the last captured value. To read the current value, issue a capture command (i.e., set ATCR[CAPTURE]) prior to reading this register.

bit_field.name: OFFSET
bit_field.description: Offset value for one-shot event generation. When the timer reaches the value, an event can be generated to reset the counter. If the increment value in ATINC is given in true nanoseconds, this value is also given in true nanoseconds.

bit_field.name: PERIOD
bit_field.description: Value for generating periodic events. Each instance the timer reaches this value, the period event occurs and the timer restarts. If the increment value in ATINC is given in true nanoseconds, this value is also given in true nanoseconds. The value should be initialized to 1,000,000,000 (1✕109) to represent a timer wrap around of one second. The increment value set in ATINC should be set to the true nanoseconds of the period of clock ts_clk, hence implementing a true 1 second counter.

bit_field.name: INC
bit_field.description: Clock Period Of The Timestamping Clock (ts_clk) In Nanoseconds

bit_field.name: TIMESTAMP
bit_field.description: Timestamp of the last frame transmitted by the core that had TxBD[TS] set . This register is only valid when EIR[TS_AVAIL] is set.

bit_field.name: TF0
bit_field.description: Copy Of Timer Flag For Channel 0

bit_field_value.name: TGSR_TF0_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Timer Flag for Channel 0 is clear

bit_field_value.name: TGSR_TF0_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Timer Flag for Channel 0 is set

bit_field.name: TF1
bit_field.description: Copy Of Timer Flag For Channel 1

bit_field_value.name: TGSR_TF1_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Timer Flag for Channel 1 is clear

bit_field_value.name: TGSR_TF1_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Timer Flag for Channel 1 is set

bit_field.name: TF2
bit_field.description: Copy Of Timer Flag For Channel 2

bit_field_value.name: TGSR_TF2_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Timer Flag for Channel 2 is clear

bit_field_value.name: TGSR_TF2_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Timer Flag for Channel 2 is set

bit_field.name: TF3
bit_field.description: Copy Of Timer Flag For Channel 3

bit_field_value.name: TGSR_TF3_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Timer Flag for Channel 3 is clear

bit_field_value.name: TGSR_TF3_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Timer Flag for Channel 3 is set

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TDRE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: DMA request is disabled

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TDRE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: DMA request is enabled

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b0000
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is disabled.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b0001
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on rising edge.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b0010
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on falling edge.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b0011
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on both edges.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b0100
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - software only.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b0101
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - toggle output on compare.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b0110
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - clear output on compare.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b0111
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - set output on compare.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b1010
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - clear output on compare, set output on overflow.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b10x1
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - set output on compare, clear output on overflow.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b1110
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - pulse output low on compare for one 1588-clock cycle.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b1111
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - pulse output high on compare for one 1588-clock cycle.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TIE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Interrupt is disabled

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TIE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Interrupt is enabled

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TF_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Input Capture or Output Compare has not occurred.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TF_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Input Capture or Output Compare has occurred.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TDRE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: DMA request is disabled

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TDRE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: DMA request is enabled

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b0000
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is disabled.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b0001
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on rising edge.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b0010
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on falling edge.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b0011
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Input Capture on both edges.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b0100
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - software only.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b0101
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - toggle output on compare.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b0110
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - clear output on compare.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b0111
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - set output on compare.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b1010
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - clear output on compare, set output on overflow.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b10x1
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - set output on compare, clear output on overflow.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b1110
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - pulse output low on compare for one 1588-clock cycle.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TMODE_0b1111
bit_field_value.description: Timer Channel is configured for Output Compare - pulse output high on compare for one 1588-clock cycle.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TIE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Interrupt is disabled

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TIE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Interrupt is enabled

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TF_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Input Capture or Output Compare has not occurred.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TF_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Input Capture or Output Compare has occurred.

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TDRE_0b0
bit_field_value.description: DMA request is disabled

bit_field_value.name: CHANNEL_TDRE_0b1
bit_field_value.description: DMA request is enabled
